chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terri A Marley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

DNA AND BLOOD DRAW FEE to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Blood draw to be paid to the Waukesha County Sheriff's. Will forward,  once paid to the Clerk's office.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample of not previously done.
Attend Victim Impact Panel.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terri A Marley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion addressed. Defense just received a pretrial offer and needs time to discuss this with her client. Defense requests bail be modified. State objects to bail modification. Court denies the request. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
for modification of bail filed by Atty. Perkins

Defendant Terri A Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail addressed on 15CM1461. Defense requests bail be modified so defendant can wear the bracelet. State does not object to a reduction of cash bail. Court orders Cash bail remains as fixed on 15CM1461. Court will give another date for plea/sentencing on all files.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
for bail modification filed by Attorney Perkins.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
